image.altText: A younger woman's hand holding an elderly patient's hand.

items.synopsis: A Queensland aged care home was flying in staff from Melbourne in a desperate attempt to keep it's doors open. Now, it's going to be forced to close.

title.children: Worker shortages force closure of Queensland aged care home that had been flying in staff from Melbourne to stay open

image.altText: Peter Dutton in the prime minister's courtyard

items.synopsis: As the government weighs whether to keep or replace Philip Lowe as RBA governor, Opposition Leader Peter Dutton says two key candidates from Treasury and Finance should be ruled out of the running.

title.children: Former RBA governor says Dutton 'silly to rule out' candidates from Treasury and Finance as next Reserve Bank head

image.altText: police tape cordoning off a crime scene. a burnt-down house can be seen in the background

items.synopsis: Murrumba Downs residents reported hearing an explosion that afternoon, shortly before the Nambucca Close home burned to the ground.

title.children: Police find human remains, multiple gas bottles after house fire north of Brisbane

image.altText: man with black beanie, brown coat and glasses sits on bed on flatbed ute with pet dog

items.synopsis: In only four months, the Wimmera's only homelessness outreach worker has found more than 60 rough sleepers. Injured abattoir worker Shane is one of them — and the number of people like him is expected to "explode".

title.children: Shane sleeps on a ute tray at night. He pretends he's camping to save face

image.altText: A Vietnamese Australian man smiles with his hands embracing his smiling wife.

items.synopsis: Australian man Chau Van Kham says his faith and the support of his family and community helped him survive the past four-and-a-half years in detention in Vietnam.

title.children: Held in Vietnamese prisons for more than four years, Australian Chau Van Kham breaks his silence

image.altText: People board a plane from the tarmac.

items.synopsis: The new carrier will cut routes and slash the number of flights to some destinations, saying it wants to improve reliability while citing a lack of "sustainable demand".

title.children: Budget airline Bonza scraps five routes in bid to 'earn trust' of Aussie travellers

image.altText: brisbane magistrates court's front doors

items.synopsis: A man has been charged with several offences, including one count of using a carriage service to make a threat to kill, after allegedly sending threatening and harassing emails to a federal politician.

title.children: Man charged over alleged threatening emails sent to federal MP

image.altText: Huw Edwards holding a sheet of paper sitting at a news desk

items.synopsis: The BBC presenter facing allegations he paid a young person thousands of pounds for sexually explicit photos is Huw Edwards, the BBC reports, citing a statement from his wife.

title.children: Highest-paid journalist at BBC, Huw Edwards, named as presenter accused of paying for explicit teen photos

image.altText: Putin KGB zelenskyy composite

items.synopsis: Vladimir Putin had already proved himself NATO's greatest recruiter, and this week's summit in Lithuania highlights just how heavily sought-after the exclusive club has become, writes John Lyons.

title.children: How the NATO summit showed off Zelenskyy's power and the lingering fear of KGB ideals

image.altText: Fighters of Wagner private mercenary group pose for a picture.

items.synopsis: Russian mercenary group Wagner reportedly hands over its weapons. What's next for the fighters and their leader after June's mutiny?

title.children: Wagner has handed over its weapons to Russia's military. What's next for the mercenary group?

image.altText: Gender dysphoria

items.synopsis: One of Australia's leading medical insurers dumps cover for private practising doctors who initiate hormone treatment in adolescents with gender dysphoria, a decision that may put even more pressure on public hospital waiting lists.

title.children: Medical insurer drops cover for doctors who initiate hormone treatments in adolescents with gender dysphoria

image.altText: Images of round metallic objects known as spherules

items.synopsis: Scientists from Harvard University have collected fragments believed to belong to a huge interstellar meteor, but PNG officials say the research was conducted within their waters without the required permits.

title.children: An exciting discovery leads to controversy as Harvard scientists collect fragments from interstellar meteor

image.altText: A man shapes to pass during a rugby league match

items.synopsis: An Origin dead rubber is what you make it, and on the back of barnstorming debuts and some brilliant returns, the Blues have found a little hope for the future.

title.children: In barnstorming debuts and brilliant returns, the Blues might have found more than just pride

image.altText: Car chase Blue Mountains

items.synopsis: Police say an officer may have fired a gun during a two-hour pursuit of a black Holden Commodore through the streets of Western Sydney this morning.

title.children: Man arrested after leading police on a two-hour pursuit through Western Sydney

image.altText: composite garside and former partner

items.synopsis: Harry Garside's ex-girlfriend is charged with assault and stalking, a month after the Olympian's domestic assault case was dropped by police.

title.children: Former girlfriend of boxer Harry Garside charged with domestic violence offences

image.altText: Christopher Eubanks raises his fist and grits his teeth at Wimbledon.

items.synopsis: Christopher Eubanks' dream run may have ended but he has a slice of Wimbledon history it took 30 years to conquer, while Aryna Sabalenka showed her power game is going to be extremely difficult to overcome.

title.children: American rewrites Wimbledon record books in defeat as Medvedev admits to 'dangerous' on court act

image.altText: A woman and a child.

items.synopsis: Foodbank Australia is calling for more funding for school breakfast programs, with a growing number of families struggling to send children to school with full bellies.

title.children: Mum-of-10 forced to cut back on school lunches as food prices 'out of control'

image.altText: Aerial shot of a rescue boat and a capsized fishing boat.

items.synopsis: A Geraldton man walks away injury-free after being rescued from his capsized boat off WA's midwest coast.

title.children: Fisherman lucky to be alive after being stranded offshore by king wave

image.altText: Man standing at kitchen bench

items.synopsis: Patrick Quintal purchased a home in the Vicinity complex in Canterbury two years ago. Last week he found out it had "potential serious defects".

title.children: Patrick bought an apartment two years ago. Now he could have to pay nearly $200k for repairs

image.altText: A car park at an outback resort with a red cliff in background.

items.synopsis: A resort west of Alice Springs will close while owners negotiate a water pipeline to be built from a bore 18 kilometres away.

title.children: Outback resort closes after water transportation costs make facility economically unviable

image.altText: an aerial shot of a 3D printed toilet block.

items.synopsis: A groundbreaking development is taking place in Dubbo, western NSW, that could alter the housing crisis gripping regional NSW.

title.children: 3D-printed toilet block built in a few days could open door to housing solutions

image.altText: A Commonwealth Bank branch in Melbourne's CBD

items.synopsis: The bosses of Westpac and Commonwealth Bank are facing the parliamentary economics committee, a day after ANZ and NAB executives were grilled over interest rates. Follow live.

title.children: Commonwealth Bank and Westpac face grilling over interest rates, US inflation slows, ASX higher

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: It's a fair question, and now we're halfway through July speculation is mounting as for when we'll learn who will be the RBA governor beyond September. Treasurer Jim Chalmers has repeatedly said the decision would be made in July, but now we're here, we have no further clarity — except for that it will be "soon". "There'll be a cabinet discussion before long about it, and then ideally, I would make an announcement immediately after that," he told RN Breakfast yesterday. Current RBA governor Philip Lowe didn't let on much when asked about it yesterday either, except for the fact that he would be "honoured" to continue on in the job if he was asked. So who else is in the running to be the next RBA governor, if it's not Philip Lowe? Here's a quick snapshot of the people who are considered the front runners: Will we get any clarity about when that cabinet discussion (and announcement) today? Only time will tell, but it's looking unlikely as the day drags on.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: When will we find out who the next RBA governor is?

children.content: It's a fair question, and now we're halfway through July speculation is mounting as for when we'll learn who will be the RBA governor beyond September.

has repeatedly said the decision would be made in July, but now we're here, we have no further clarity — except for that it will be "soon".
"There'll be a
cabinet discussion before long about it
, and then ideally, I would make an announcement immediately after that," he told RN Breakfast yesterday.
Current RBA governor Philip Lowe
didn't let on much when asked about it yesterday either, except for the fact that he would be "honoured" to continue on in the job if he was asked.
So who else is in the running to be the next RBA governor, if it's not Philip Lowe?
Here's a quick snapshot of the people who are considered the front runners:
Will we get any clarity about when that cabinet discussion (and announcement) today? Only time will tell, but it's looking unlikely as the day drags on.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: With such a tight labour market, many employers have been hiring older workers. Are you a retiree who's re-joined the workforce in the last year? Perhaps you've started working to help with your rising costs? We want to hear if you've recently started working again — or are a business that has hired older workers — and what that experience is like. Follow the link below to a form to share your story, and our journalists might just be in touch.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Have you headed back to work after retiring?

featuredLink.title: Have you returned to the workforce from retirement? We'd like to hear why

children.content: With such a tight labour market, many employers have been hiring older workers.
Are you a retiree who's re-joined the workforce in the last year?
Perhaps you've started working to help with your rising costs?
We want to hear if you've recently started working again —
or are a business that has hired older workers —
and what that experience is like.
Follow the link below to a form to share your story, and our journalists might just be in touch.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: New Australian airline Bonza will scrap five of its regional routes and reduce the number of flights to some destinations due to low demand. The airline only began taking passengers from January this year, and ruled out cutting struggling routes back in May. Bonza will no longer offer flights from its Sunshine Coast base to Port Macquarie, Coffs Harbour and Tamworth. Flights have also been cancelled from Toowoomba to the Whitsundays, and Cairns to Mackay. Instead, Bonza's chief operating officer Carly Povey said the airline would offer extra flights to popular destinations, including Melbourne and Albury. The airline will stop serving the affected routes from August 1 .
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Bonza scraps five airline routes due to lack of 'sustainable demand'

featuredLink.title: Budget airline Bonza scraps five routes in bid to 'earn trust' of Aussie travellers

Port Macquarie, Coffs Harbour and Tamworth
Flights have also been cancelled from
Toowoomba to the Whitsundays

Cairns to Mackay
Instead, Bonza's chief operating officer Carly Povey said the airline would offer extra flights to popular destinations, including

The airline will stop serving the affected routes
from August 1

image.altText: A photo of an older white man is seen alongside books in a shop window.

items.synopsis: Kundera, dubbed "the most European of writers", died in his Paris apartment following a long illness.

title.children: Milan Kundera, author of The Unbearable Lightness of Being, dies aged 94

image.altText: An aerial view of houses in Hobart, Tasmania.

items.synopsis: Homebuyers are reporting an unregulated "buyer beware" market has led them to purchase homes with serious defects, even after pre-purchase building inspections. So what are the rules and what recourse do buyers have?

title.children: 'Luck of the draw' for potential buyers doing due diligence

image.altText: A designed image showing John Zeitoune, Jye West and a building bearing an ACU logo.

items.synopsis: The Australian Catholic University has launched an internal inquiry after the ABC discovered the founder of the company providing its on-campus security has been charged with corruption — and had a secret business relationship with an employee overseeing its security contract.

title.children: 'I was told to shut up': Australian Catholic University accused of ignoring concerns about security contractor

image.altText: Two police cars surround a black car

items.synopsis: The four girls, aged 14 to 15, are charged over the alleged incident in Adelaide's inner north-east.

title.children: Group of teenage girls carjack ride-share Lexus at knifepoint, SA police say

image.altText: A woman wearing a bright yellow face mask look down at a nurse putting a sticker bandaid on her arm after a vaccination.

items.synopsis: Flu vaccine uptake in recent months across Australia is almost 2 million down on what it was last year, with experts blaming COVID 'fatigue' and cost-of-living pressures. Two students have died from influenza this week, including an 11-year-old Queensland girl and a teenager from NSW.

title.children: Flu vaccine numbers are down by almost two million. What's to blame?

image.altText: aerial view of a car crossing a bridge in an outback setting

items.synopsis: Residents are excited to see if cars such as ZOE.2 can solve the swathe of transport issues and the tyranny of distance faced in the outback.

title.children: Australia's 'most advanced' driverless car takes on outback roads

image.altText: Fish over ice in big blue buckets

items.synopsis: The proportion of "green" zones in a major marine park has been boosted to conserve the region's biodiversity as commercial fishers are promised a "targeted compensation package".

title.children: Major expansion of no-fish zones in Queensland seafood hotspot

image.altText: Man sets himself on fire at Sonsa Market

items.synopsis: Victoria Police believe two feuding organised crime gangs are behind a string of arson attacks across Melbourne, including a Collingwood supermarket that was torched last month.

title.children: Man catches fire after arson attack on Melbourne shop linked to crime gangs

items.synopsis: Musicians have been entertaining families from this Cairns hall for generations, but its prime location puts it in the path of a major hospital development.

title.children: Historic band hall set for demolition to make way for car park
